content: A famous French landmark, this iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris is named after its engineer.

Ah, you're thinking about one of the most iconic structures in the world! The Eiffel Tower, right? It's named after Gustave Eiffel, the engineer who designed it. Built in 1889 for the World's Fair, it was initially criticized by some of France's leading artists and intellectuals, but it has since become a beloved symbol of France and one of the most visited paid monuments in the world.
